full_text: Darlene from Asheboro, NC became very ill and was out of work for 8 months to seek medical treatment. She used #SNAP benefits to put food on her table while she recovered.
Shoshana in Raleigh used food stamps shortly after getting divorced to make ends meet for her and her sons. She worked full time and needed the extra assistance to get back on her feet.
Mallory from Fayetteville, NC was laid off from her job and relied on #SNAP to help feed her family for a few months while she looked for a new job.
Shae from Knightdale, NC used #SNAP to purchase milk and baby food when her husband lost his job and she was in school.

Dee from Durham, NC was raised on #SNAP. Her father was an alcoholic who couldn't hold down a job & her mother was often paid less than her male coworkers. Because of SNAP she was able to feed her 3 children & Dee was able to go onto graduate college & lift herself out of poverty
Tom from Asheville, NC is a handicapped senior who relies on #SNAP to put nutritious food on his table. Due to his injury, he cannot work.
Jenny in Creston, NC is the sole caregiver for her severely disabled husband.  Leaving him alone for hours at a time is not an option. Jenny relies on #SNAP to put food on their table.

Many NC families depend on #SNAP to put food on their tables. I'm proud to be their voice in Congress and I'm proud to share their stories today. Thank you to @MomsRising for lifting their stories up as well.

I can't imagine that anyone would support taking food away from 265,000 children nationwide. Yet, that's what this proposal does. No one should wonder where their next meal will come from-especially children. #FarmBill

I'm a member of the Nutrition Subcommittee and last Thursday was the first time I saw any language about the nutrition title in this bill. How can we possibly say this bill was bipartisan? It was not. #FarmBill

In my opening comments I shared my concerns about this partisan #farmbill. NC is 11th in the nation for food insecurity. In NC-12 nearly 50,000 kids are at risk of going to bed hungry every night. These are not just numbers, these are people. I will not support this flawed bill.
